alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 05 at 1:33PM CDT until July 05 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN JO DAVIESS...NORTHWESTERN CARROLL AND SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON COUNTIES... At 132 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Reeceville, or 17 miles west of Mount Carroll, moving northeast at 15 mph. A second severe thunderstorm was near Massbach, also moving northeast. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Hanover, Elizabeth, Woodbine, Miles, Green Island, Massbach, Van Buren, Mississippi Palisades State Park, Whitton, Elizabeth Fairgrounds, Reeceville, Elmoville and Camp Far Horizons. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
